docs.lead_paragraph: The Momentum Movement, a new group in Hungary whose push for a referendum made Budapest withdraw its bid to host the 2024 Olympic Games, said Sunday it has become a political party.

headline.print_headline: Hungary: Group Which Led Olympic Bid Retreat Enters Politics
headline.main: Hungary: Group Which Led Olympic Bid Retreat Enters Politics

docs.snippet: The Momentum Movement, a new group in Hungary whose push for a referendum made Budapest withdraw its bid to host the 2024 Olympic Games, said Sunday it has become a political party....

docs.lead_paragraph: British asset management firms Aberdeen and Standard Life are in talks about a possible merger that could create one of the country's largest fund managers.

headline.main: UK Asset Managers Standard Life, Aberdeen Discuss Merger

docs.snippet: British asset management firms Aberdeen and Standard Life are in talks about a possible merger that could create one of the country's largest fund managers....

docs.lead_paragraph: Embattled French presidential candidate Francois Fillon delivered a defiant speech to thousands of supporters in central Paris on Sunday, but made no pledge to fight on as pressure from his conservative party mounted on him to step aside.

headline.print_headline: France's Fillon Makes No Promises to Stay as Party Fights for Electoral Survival
headline.main: France's Fillon Makes No Promises to Stay as Party Fights for Electoral Survival

docs.snippet: Embattled French presidential candidate Francois Fillon delivered a defiant speech to thousands of supporters in central Paris on Sunday, but made no pledge to fight on as pressure from his conservative party mounted on him to step aside....

docs.lead_paragraph: French presidential candidate Francois Fillon will speak on France 2 television's Sunday evening news program, the broadcaster said, after he had earlier canceled a Monday morning radio appearance that was to discuss his campaign.

headline.print_headline: Embattled French Candidate Fillon to Appear on Sunday Evening News
headline.main: Embattled French Candidate Fillon to Appear on Sunday Evening News

docs.snippet: French presidential candidate Francois Fillon will speak on France 2 television's Sunday evening news program, the broadcaster said, after he had earlier canceled a Monday morning radio appearance that was to discuss his campaign....

docs.lead_paragraph: Europe's automakers face huge questions: the impact of Britain's decision to leave the European Union, President Donald Trump's proposed border tax on imports, the uncertain prospects for electric vehicles.

docs.lead_paragraph: A rescue helicopter carrying nine people crashed in snow-covered mountains in central Japan during a training flight Sunday, leaving at least three people dead and four missing.

headline.print_headline: Rescue Helicopter Crashes in Central Japan; At Least 3 Dead
headline.main: Rescue Helicopter Crashes in Central Japan; At Least 3 Dead

docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. citizen of Indian origin was shot in the arm while in his driveway by a man who the victim said told him to “go back to your own country.”

docs.lead_paragraph: The leader of the populist, euroskeptic Finns Party says that he will step down in June when the party votes for a new chairman, leaving no clear leader to take over.

headline.print_headline: Leader of Populist Finns Party to Step Down in June
headline.main: Leader of Populist Finns Party to Step Down in June

docs.snippet: The leader of the populist, euroskeptic Finns Party says that he will step down in June when the party votes for a new chairman, leaving no clear leader to take over....

docs.lead_paragraph: The tone of private discussions between Britain and other members of the European Union about Brexit has improved since earlier this year, British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Brexit 'Mood Music' Better, EU More Pragmatic: Hammond
headline.main: Brexit 'Mood Music' Better, EU More Pragmatic: Hammond

docs.snippet: The tone of private discussions between Britain and other members of the European Union about Brexit has improved since earlier this year, British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Sunday....

docs.lead_paragraph: From kitchen items to livestock and even her house, Assa Mkwananzi says she has "lost it all" to floods that have hit southern Zimbabwe.
